result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • John C Weichman Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
****Sept. 2, 2014/ORDER granting credit for sentence time served/Judge William Brash/Court grants 26 days of sentence credit on case 14CF390 and -0- days credit on 14CF 391.****
Consecutive to: any other time being served.  Credit to be determined.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse program after serving the first year of this sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Probation conditions to apply, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Fine of $1,200.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.   To be paid by end of probation period. Any remaining balance to convert to a civil judgment. Bail to apply.
Obtain/maintain full time employment for full time school with part time employment.

Referral for mental health assessment and if necessary complete follow up care/treatment. 
Take any prescribed medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.

No drugs or alcohol.  No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users, dealers, houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of  probable cause.

Cooperate with all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment.   Complete follow up care/treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms; also informed he may not vote in  any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release for medical care/treatment. Electronic monitoring not prohibited by the Court.  If electronic monitoring is granted the Court will allow release for attorney contact, court appearances and grocery shopping.

**DECISION & ORDER dated April 6, 2015, Judge William Brash: IT IS ORDERED that the defendant IS ELIGIBLE to earn good time credit while serving the conditional jail term in both cases.***

Order Reinstating Huber Privileges for Medical Care and Treatment, signed and filed.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED, for the reasons stated on the record at the hearing on February 26, 2015, that Mr. Weichman's Huber release privileges are reinstated to allow his release for up to FOUR hours per week for the purpose of verifiable medical care and treatment.

Defendant John C Weichman in court with attorney Hannah Blair Schieber.  Defendant John C Weichman in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court on defense motion for reinstatement of Huber privileges.  Oral arguments made by the state and defense.  The Court orders (reinstates) Huber privileges as follows: Release for medical appointments/treatment up to 4 hours per week (subject to verification).  Defense to submit a proposed order under the 5-day rule.  Reinstated privileges to commence upon signing of order.
Court of Appeals order dated February 24, 2015, Appeal 2015XX299CR, cases 14CF390 and 14CF391, the deadline to file a post-conviction motion or notice of appeal is extended to March 23, 2015.

Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 08/14/14. AR

Defendant John C Weichman in court with attorney Kiley Beth Zellner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Motion Hearing.  Plea forms tendered by Attorney Zellner.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Defense indicates that the defendant does not stipulate to all the facts in the complaint but it may be used as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 years) and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations, by operation of law (as to Count 2), and on state's motion the Court orders Counts 2, 3, and 4 DISMISSED.  

Case passed for Sentencing Hearing later this morning.....

CASE RECALLED......SAME APPEARANCES.....

Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made by the state, defense, Chras W.,and defendant.   Case passed to 1:30 p.m. due to the lateness of the hour (12pm).  The Court ordered REMANDED into custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
WCS Report received and filed.

Defendant John C Weichman in court with attorney Kiley Beth Zellner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  WCS report, filed. Parties may resolve this matter with a plea agreement and then proceed to sentencing on the next court date.  Case remains calendared for a motion hearing on August 8, 2014 at 8:30 am.

Defendant John C Weichman in court with attorney Dan Meylink.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21. Court entered a not guilty plea on misdemeanor count on behalf of the defendant. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Dan Meylink in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
